Instruction: Start by cooking the chicken breasts. Season them with salt and pepper, then grill or pan-sear them over medium-high heat until cooked through, about 6-7 minutes per side. Alternatively, you can poach or bake the chicken breasts until fully cooked.
Once the chicken breasts are cooked, let them cool slightly, then chop them into bite-sized pieces. Place the chopped chicken in a large mixing bowl.
Chop the celery stalks into small pieces and add them to the bowl with the chicken.
Finely chop the red onion and add it to the bowl as well.
In a separate small bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, Greek yogurt, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper until well combined.
Pour the dressing over the chicken and vegetables in the large mixing bowl.
Gently toss everything together until the chicken and vegetables are evenly coated with the dressing.
Taste the chicken salad and adjust the seasoning if needed, adding more salt, pepper, or lemon juice according to your preference.

To serve, place lettuce leaves on a plate or in a bowl and spoon the chicken salad on top. You can also serve the chicken salad in sandwiches or wraps. Enjoy your delicious and refreshing chicken salad!
